verse.roman:
yāvanty ahāni nandasya
vraje 'vātsīt sa uddhavaḥ
vrajaukasāṁ kṣaṇa-prāyāṇy
āsan kṛṣṇasya vārtayā

synonyms: yāvanti—for as many; ahāni—days; nandasya—of King Nanda; vraje—in the cowherd village; avātsīt—dwelled; saḥ—he; uddhavaḥ—Uddhava; vraja-okasām—for the residents of Vraja; kṣaṇa-prāyāṇi—passing like a moment; āsan—they were; kṛṣṇasya—about Kṛṣṇa; vārtayā—because of the discussions.
translation: All the days that Uddhava dwelled in Nanda's cowherd village seemed like a single moment to the residents of Vraja, for Uddhava was always discussing Kṛṣṇa.
